Burn Rate is the Latency of Failure

This isn‚Äôt ‚ÄúR&D investment‚Äù. It‚Äôs a systemic loss orgy of coupling. Running AI isn‚Äôt like running a bakery CRUD app; every inference, every ‚ÄúGood morning‚Äù sent to a chatbot, is a GPU cycle that costs real money, raw electricity, and cooling. The Great Sludge Centrifuge

Enter the weirdest semantic narcissism in the history of computing: where do they get the data to train these 14-billion-dollar monsters? From the sewer of the internet. But there‚Äôs a critical bug in our civilization‚Äôs runtime: the internet is now infested with content generated by‚Ä¶ AI.

We‚Äôre entering the age of digital autophagy. The process is a civilizational segmentation fault:

  • AI generates a generic, soulless post about ‚Äúproductivity‚Äù.
  • OpenAI‚Äôs scraper collects that syntactic garbage.

Anatomy of Collapse

Utility gain per dollar spent is in free fall. We‚Äôre paying billions for an assistant that writes passive-aggressive emails better than a marketing intern, while the physical infrastructure‚Äîhardware, power, and investors‚Äô patience‚Äîis waving the white flag.

Verdict: The Global Segfault

The situation is one of deep technical sadness. We‚Äôre building the Tower of Babel with bricks made of wind and foreign-debt mortar. Hardware doesn‚Äôt negotiate, and physics doesn‚Äôt do strategic ‚Äúpivots‚Äù.
